detailPageContent.title: Our Mission: Our Core Purpose
detailPageContent.paragraph: To retell narratives of society and family roles and expectations through the mediums of storytelling and visual arts.

detailPageContent.title: Our Vision
detailPageContent.paragraph: To help create a world where diverse family and social roles are challenged, understood, and re-imagined through art and storytelling.

detailPageContent.title: Goals of The Sansa Initiative
detailPageContent.paragraph: Our goals are designed to translate our mission and vision into impactful action.

rows: Goal 1: Secure Core Resources and Launch Artistic Productions

In the first two years, we aim to secure funding through grant applications, acquire necessary production equipment, and launch at least two major artistic projects (such as a thematic series, major exhibition/festival, publications) that embody our mission and build organizational credibility.
Goal 2: Build an Artist Community and Launch Pilot Residency
Within the first 24–36 months, we will establish an engaged community and launch a pilot residency program supporting at least two artists, laying the foundation for our future art center.
Goal 3: Develop a Plan and Secure a Physical Hub for The Sansa Art Center

Within 12–18 months, we will finalize a business plan for the art center, including needs assessment, financial projections, and an operational model, followed by the search for a physical location and funding proposals by the end of Year 2.
Goal 4: Achieve Financial Sustainability through Diversified Income Streams
We aim to establish at least three earned income streams within two years—such as ticketed events, publications, and merchandise—to reduce reliance on grants and enhance organizational resilience.

detailPageContent.title: Strategies of The Sansa Initiative
detailPageContent.paragraph: To achieve our mission, vision, and goals, we follow four strategic pillars:

rows: Produce signature projects that address our core themes and attract wide audiences.
Highlight underrepresented perspectives through exhibitions, showcases, and collaborations.
Use innovative storytelling and visual methods to engage diverse audiences.
Offer training in artistic techniques and professional development.
Host events to foster artist connections and collaborative growth.
Conduct needs assessments and strategic planning for our future space.
Organize public events to share our work and expand audience reach.
Collaborate with institutions to bring our themes into learning spaces.
Build a strong online identity for storytelling and community engagement.
Complete legal steps to establish as a registered NPO.
Recruit a diverse and strategic advisory group for governance and growth.
Pursue grants, donations, and earned income strategies to support operations.
Develop a clear brand identity and messaging platform.
Define metrics to track progress and demonstrate impact.

detailPageContent.title: Organizational Structure: Non-Profit (NPO)
detailPageContent.paragraph: The Sansa Initiative will operate as a Non-Profit Organization (NPO) to align our structure with our mission.
listItems: Maximize eligibility for arts and cultural grants.
Benefit from tax exemptions and increase donor incentives.
Foster trust and accountability with transparent governance.
Reinvest all surplus revenue into our programs.
Strengthen community support through donations and volunteering.

detailPageContent.title: My Reasons
detailPageContent.paragraph:
I don't know, I could say you grew in me, and by chance, accident, or just by imagination, you triggered many thoughts and actions on my side.

There is something about you that reminds my soul of dreams, values and ideals that are the ones I live by, and want to keep living by. And this will sound stupid, but after we met in Chicago, part of my brain has recorded a feeling of who you are—gestures, voice tones, who knows what my brain records...

And since then, when I see your content, I can see beyond the content, and notice your fatigue, sadness, happiness.

To summarize, I don't know why, at least not with words, but I know that at this moment, it is the right thing to do.

detailPageContent.title: The trigger of this initiative
detailPageContent.paragraph:
3 episodes: The wrong Miriam, Makkot 21 and The Song of Serach. 

 In two of them you looked tired, a different kind of tiredness and fatigue that the one that brings an active life; and in the other one you were splendid, whimsical, and brilliant. and that's when I thought... Nothing, nothing at all. Until I went for a run, and it came to me as sentence: 'We're missing a Sansa Foundation'.
